sentence: in the past, individuals seeking credit to purchase a home, or seeking to borrow for some other reason, either did or did not meet the specific underwriting criteria for a particular loan product; if they did, everyone paid about the same price for that product.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: today, in part because of advances in credit scoring and underwriting technology, lenders can price loans according to risk, charging different borrowers different prices on the basis of a borrowerâ€™s estimated creditworthiness.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: in the subprime market, higher-risk borrowers pay higher prices.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: but this same price variability has raised concerns about unequal treatment of borrowers.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: the board responded to these concerns by amending regulation c, the regulation that implements hmda, to expand the available data on higher-priced lending.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: the data contain price information for loans whose prices exceeded thresholds set by the board.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: therefore, we call loans whose prices exceed the reporting threshold "higher-priced loans" rather than "subprime loans."

sentence: the new data on higher-priced loans are yet another "screen" to make our fair lending supervision more effective.

sentence: indeed, the federal reserve was examining for potential price discrimination well before it adopted the hmda price-reporting requirement.

sentence: although price reporting under hmda is limited to higher-priced loans, examiners look for unlawful price discrimination at any pricing level.

sentence: federal reserve examiners use an institutionâ€™s hmda data, including its accept-deny data for loan applications and any price data it may have reported on originations, in conjunction with other information about the institution to determine the focus of the institutionâ€™s fair lending examination.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: starting in 2005, these analyses incorporated loan-price data.

sentence: to gauge the risk of price discrimination, examiners consider, among other types of information, the presence of broad employee or broker discretion in pricing and the relationship, if any, between pricing and the compensation of loan officers or brokers.

sentence: thus, a narrowing of the difference between short-term and long-term rates, such as occurred from 2004 to 2005, may increase the proportion of loans reported as higher-priced loans.
